method: Put the figs, sugar and ground ginger into a large non-metallic bowl, cover and leave for 6-8 hours. Transfer the figs and sugar to a large saucepan or preserving pan, add the apple, crystallised ginger, vinegar, lemons and water. Stir over a low heat until the sugar has dissolved. Bring to the boil and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the fruit is soft and setting point is reached. Remove the jam from the heat and leave to cool for 20-25 minutes. Pour into the warm jam jars and cover/seal straight away. Label and store in a cool dark place for 2-3 weeks to allow the flavours to develop.
ingredients: 1.35kg/3lb ripe figs, washed and diced,  1.35kg/3lb warm preserving sugar (see note below),  1½ tbsp ground ginger,  1 cooking apple, peeled and diced,  4 tbsp crystallised stem ginger, chopped roughly,  5 tbsp white wine vinegar,  3 lemons, juice only,  290ml/½ pint water
